title: General
description: General requirements for indoor agriculture operations including on-site food safety responsibility, organic certification (if applicable), hygiene and health rules, and integrated pest management programs

requirements.text: Is there a trained on-site person responsible for the operation's food safety program?
mandatoryStatements: A specific person is designated as responsible for food safety program
Person is on-site at the indoor agriculture operation
Person has received food safety training appropriate to their role
Training records document food safety qualifications
Person has authority to implement food safety decisions
Responsibilities are clearly defined in job description or organizational chart
requirements.verificationExpectations: Annual verification of food safety manager training and competency, quarterly verification of food safety program implementation
requirements.monitoringExpectations: Daily presence of food safety manager verified, ongoing monitoring of food safety program activities

requirements.text: If the operation is growing under organic principles, is there written documentation of current certification by an accredited organic certification organization?
mandatoryStatements: If claiming organic status, current organic certification is maintained
Certification is from an accredited organic certification organization
Certification documentation is available for review
Certification scope covers the products being grown
Certification is current and not expired
requirements.verificationExpectations: Annual verification of organic certification status and renewal, verification during organic product production
requirements.monitoringExpectations: Monitor certification expiration dates, ensure certification remains current throughout production season

requirements.text: Does the operation have written food safety hygiene and health rules covering at least worker and visitor hygiene and health, infants and toddlers, animal presence in growing and storage areas, fecal matter, dropped product, blood and bodily fluids?
mandatoryStatements: Written food safety hygiene and health rules are documented
Rules address worker hygiene and health requirements
Rules address visitor hygiene and health requirements
Policy prohibits infants and toddlers in growing and storage areas
Policy prohibits animals in growing and storage areas
Procedures address response to fecal matter contamination
Procedures address handling of dropped product
Procedures address response to blood and bodily fluid contamination
Rules are communicated to all workers and visitors
Rules are posted in appropriate locations
requirements.verificationExpectations: Annual review of hygiene and health rules, quarterly verification that rules are followed and communicated
requirements.monitoringExpectations: Daily monitoring of worker and visitor hygiene compliance, immediate response to hygiene violations

requirements.text: Is there a documented and implemented Integrated Pest Management (IPM) program in place?
mandatoryStatements: Integrated Pest Management (IPM) program is documented
IPM program is implemented in indoor agriculture operation
Program defines pest prevention strategies
Program includes monitoring and detection methods
Program specifies control measures appropriate for indoor agriculture
Program emphasizes non-chemical controls where possible
Records demonstrate IPM program implementation
requirements.verificationExpectations: Annual review of IPM program effectiveness, quarterly verification of IPM activities
requirements.monitoringExpectations: Weekly monitoring of pest activity, ongoing implementation of IPM strategies

capaInject: If no trained food safety person on-site: immediately designate responsible person, provide required training within 30 days
If hygiene and health rules not documented: develop and document rules within 14 days, train all personnel within 30 days
If hygiene violations observed: immediate corrective action, retraining of affected personnel within 7 days
If IPM program not documented or implemented: develop program within 30 days, implement monitoring within 14 days
traceabilityInject: Food safety manager training records must be traceable to specific training dates and content
Organic certification documentation must be traceable to certification body and scope
Hygiene rule violations and corrective actions must be documented and traceable
IPM program records must be traceable to specific activities, dates, and personnel
